definition: to fix/to settle/a libation to the dead

sentences.english: Wang Guowei is the founder of China's modern aesthetic.
sentences.chinese: 王國維是中國現代美學的奠基者。

sentences.english: Prof, Zhu Kezhcn is both a pioneer and a founder of modern geography in China.
sentences.chinese: 竺可楨教授是中國近代科學地理學的先驅與奠基人。

sentences.english: The photo shows the construction commencement ceremony of the Dali Highway.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲大理至麗江高速公路開工奠基儀式。

sentences.english: He was the founder of North Korea.
Luxun and Hushi are explorer and founder of Chinese modem literature.
sentences.chinese: 魯迅與胡適是新文學的開創者與奠基人。

sentences.english: It is thought to be a cornerstone of free speech on the Web.
sentences.chinese: 這被視爲是網絡言論自由的奠基石。

sentences.english: Robespierre was the founder of French democratic politics and of virtue.
sentences.chinese: 羅伯斯比爾是法國民主政治的奠基人和關德的締造者。

sentences.english: But it might be a ground-up launching pad for the newspapers of tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 但是，它會是未來報業的奠基石。

sentences.english: Compradors had made much contribution to the foundation of the insurance industry.
sentences.chinese: 買辦於民族保險業實有開拓奠基之功。

sentences.english: A grand foundation stone laying ceremony for Asian Packaging Center Edifice was held yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 亞包大廈奠基儀式昨在錢江新城隆重舉行。

sentences.english: Primary schools lay the foundations in cultivating citizens' basic qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 小學教育則對公民基本素質的養成起着奠基性作用。

sentences.english: Who is the founder of the scientific socialism?
sentences.chinese: 誰是社會主義的奠基人。

sentences.english: Self-confidence is one of the cornerstones of success.
sentences.chinese: 自信是成功的奠基石之一。

sentences.english: Ding Wenjiang was an initiator and one of the modern founders of China's geological cause.
sentences.chinese: 丁文江是我國近代地質事業的開創者和奠基人之一。

sentences.english: Feudal economic structure formulated in Warring States period.
sentences.chinese: 戰國秦漢時期是我國封建制度的奠基時期。

sentences.english: They believed the nation was a "new order for the ages."
sentences.chinese: 因爲奠基者們認爲，這個國家是“舊時代的新秩序”。

definition: to lay (a foundation)/to conquer (a city etc)/to shoot down (a bird etc)
lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
a project of vital and lasting importance
lit. to fly upwards swiftly/fig. rapid advance/rapidly developing (situation)
